pages.text: You'll notice you're $(#00a800)sensitive to temperature, now$(). You'll need to keep a close eye on your body temps if you want to survive here.$(br2)When you're too warm, your $(#00a800)thirst will increase$(), so be sure to $(#00a800)stay hydrated$(), especially in hot areas.

When you're too cold, your body will start burning energy, $(#00a800)increasing your hunger$(). So you'll always want to keep some food on you.$(br2)There are other ways of dealing with the elements, too. Clothes. Different types of food. Jumping into water.

Firstly, you can make $(#00a8a8)Clothing$() out of $(#00a8a8)Wool$() or $(#00a8a8)Leather$(), depending on whether you're living somewhere cold or hot. This is good for $(#00a800)avoiding exposure$(), but isn't great if you've got to $(6)face monsters$(), so you might want to upgrade to...

pages.title: Cooling/Thermal Coats
pages.text: $(#00a8a8)Coats$() are linings which you can $(6)sew into existing armor$() to make it $(#00a800)adapt to the heat or cold$().$(br)There are 3 levels of rarity, which provide $(#00a800)better bonuses$() the higher you go.

There's also $(#00a8a8)Food and Drinks$() which grant resistance to either $(#00a800)heat or cold$() for varying amounts, and varying lengths of time. Check your $(#00a800)known recipes$() for more information.
Finally, you can brew $(#00a8a8)Potions$() of both $(#00a800)heat and cold resistance$(), which are helpful so long as you have a $(#00a8a8)Brewing$() setup. Which, arguably, you really should.
